description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft ODBC Driver remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2023-35639), it is crucial to apply the relevant KB updates. The specific updates that resolve this vulnerability include:

1. Download and install KB5033379 for Windows 10 and Windows 11 users.
2. For systems requiring specific builds, ensure updates KB5033372, KB5033375, and KB5033369 are also applied based on your system version.
3. Access the update packages through the official Microsoft Update Catalog listed below.

**Details**:
This vulnerability could allow remote code execution if an affected ODBC driver processes a specially crafted data stream. By applying these updates, you will mitigate the risk associated with this security vulnerability. For manual installation of the updates, you can visit:
- [KB5033118](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033118)
- [KB5033422](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033422)
- [KB5033373](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033373)
- [KB5033379](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033379)
- [KB5033375](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033375)
- [KB5033369](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033369)
- [KB5033429](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033429)
- [KB5033433](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033433)
- [KB5033420](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033420)
- [KB5033383](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033383)
- [KB5033372](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033372)

**Preconditions**:
- Verify that you are applying the updates for the correct Windows version (e.g., Windows 10 or Windows 11).
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
